subject: Economics
title: The Gini Coefficient: One Number to Measure Unfairness
description: Learn The Gini Coefficient: One Number to Measure Unfairness in one minute.

hook.text: A single number between 0 and 1 tells you how equally a country shares its wealth. Zero means perfect equality.

buildup.text: Corrado Gini invented the coefficient in 1912. It compares the actual income distribution to a perfectly equal one.

discovery.text: Denmark scores 0.28 (very equal). The US scores 0.39. South Africa scores 0.63 â€” the world's most unequal nation.

twist.text: The Gini has a blind spot: a country of millionaires and a country of paupers can have the same Gini if incomes are.

climax.text: No single number captures inequality perfectly.

punchline.text: One number can't explain inequality. But it can reveal it.
